title: System and method capable of remotely and automatically generating dynamic video of rice growth process
applicants: GUANGZHOU AIMI ECOLOGICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE CO LTD
abstract: The invention relates to a system and method capable of remotely and automatically generating a rice growth process dynamic video, and the method comprises the steps: collecting on-site image data through a data collection device, storing the image data to a file storage center of a remote data center, and storing corresponding image meta-information data to a meta-information database of the remote data center; the task scheduling module transmits the image data in the file storage center to the artificial intelligence processing module for identification, and then transmits an identification result of the artificial intelligence processing module to the meta-information database for storage; and the video data generation module generates specified rice video data based on the data of the meta-information database according to the request of the client, and the specified rice video data are acquired by the client. And the acquisition of rice video data is realized through the video data generation module, and the automation level of rice monitoring is improved.

title: Intelligent rice field weed recognition method, device and equipment and medium
applicants: GUANGZHOU AIMI ECOLOGICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE CO LTD
abstract: The invention discloses an intelligent rice field weed recognition method, device and equipment and a medium, and relates to the technical field of computer vision. The intelligent rice field weed identification method comprises the steps of obtaining a first picture set according to a plurality of first videos; the first picture set comprises a plurality of first pictures, and the first pictures carry weed type information of the first video; searching an optimal deep residual network structure to obtain a first deep residual network structure; training the deep residual network according to the plurality of first picture sets and the weed type information to obtain a rice field weed recognition model; and inputting the second picture into the paddy field weed recognition model to obtain a first recognition result. According to the method, the paddy field weed video and the weed type information are input, and the artificial intelligence recognition model of the deep residual network is utilized to recognize the input picture to obtain the recognition result, so that the paddy field weeds are intelligently and efficiently recognized.

title: Rice picture intelligent auditing method, system, device and equipment
applicants: GUANGZHOU AIMI ECOLOGICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE CO LTD
abstract: The invention discloses a rice picture intelligent auditing method and device, equipment and a medium, and relates to the technical field of image processing. According to the rice picture intelligent auditing method, three auditing detection steps are set, intelligent auditing is carried out on the input picture by utilizing an artificial intelligence recognition model and combining regional information, hash value information and growth cycle characteristics of rice crops, and the rice crop picture auditing efficiency and accuracy are improved.

title: Artificial intelligence automatic feeding equipment for agriculture and animal husbandry
abstract: The invention discloses artificial intelligence agriculture and animal husbandry automatic feeding equipment which comprises a stirring box and a self-propelled trolley, movable supporting columns are symmetrically hinged to one side of the bottom end of the stirring box, fixed supporting columns are symmetrically hinged to the other side of the bottom end of the stirring box, a horn opening is formed in the right side of the stirring box, and a supporting plate is installed on the back face of the stirring box; a first material guide groove is formed in the upper end face of the supporting plate, the side, close to the stirring box, of the first material guide groove extends into the stirring box, rotating supporting columns are symmetrically arranged on the front face of the stirring box, and stirring mechanisms are installed on the rotating supporting columns. The device is provided with a feed stirring mechanism, a discharging mechanism and a movable stirring roller mechanism, the functions of stirring and mixing, automatic discharging and automatic feeding are achieved, the automation degree of the device is improved, an inner cavity of a stirring container is easy to clean, the cleanliness of animal feed is guaranteed, and the device is suitable for popularization and application. And popularization and application of the device in agriculture and animal husbandry are facilitated.

title: Remote and autonomous control harvesting, processing and conveying device
abstract: The invention discloses a far-end and autonomous-control harvesting, processing and conveying device, which aims at heavy physical labor, a lot of time and manpower are spent on harvesting, the far-end and autonomous-control harvesting of plants and underground fruits is realized by adopting a far-end and autonomous-control harvesting device, and the device comprises an autonomous harvesting device, a radar autonomous navigation device and a moving device, a ground penetrating device for detecting underground fruits, a conveying belt, a light processing device and a vibration device are integrated, harvesting, light processing, packaging, conveying and storing are achieved, intelligent management of crop harvesting is achieved, and the intelligent crop harvesting machine is applied to the field of artificial intelligence agriculture.

title: Remote and autonomous control intelligent greenhouse device and optimal cultivation method
abstract: The invention discloses a remote and autonomous control intelligent greenhouse device and an optimized cultivation method, and aims to solve the problems that heavy physical labor is heavy, cultivation operation spends a large amount of time and manpower, the remote and autonomous control greenhouse device realizes remote and autonomous control cultivation, irrigation and intelligent planting, and the greenhouse device comprises a sliding device and a sliding module, a temperature acquisition and regulation module, a humidity acquisition and regulation module, a soil sensor acquisition device, an oxygen and carbon dioxide sensor acquisition and regulation device, an air blowing device, an irradiation device, a spraying irrigation device, insect killing, irrigation, fertilization and cultivation are adopted, intelligent crop management and intelligent cultivation are achieved, and the system is applied to the field of artificial intelligence agriculture.

title: Far-end and autonomously-controlled cultivation, irrigation and picking device and method
abstract: The invention discloses a far-end and autonomously-controlled cultivating, irrigating and picking device and method, and aims to solve the problems of high labor capacity, heavy physical labor and low operation efficiency. The far-end and autonomously-controlled cultivating, irrigating and picking device and autonomously control are adopted to realize the purpose of cultivating and irrigating and picking fruits in a house and a far-end and autonomously-controlled cultivating and farming field. Aiming at the problems of crop growth death, poor fruit quality and the like caused by low planting efficiency and unbalanced soil fertilizer and microorganisms, the invention provides a remote and autonomous control telescopic soil turning shovel, shovel, soil loosening device, sharp claw type hoe arm, rake, seeding device, autonomous seeding, radar autonomous navigation, movement, plant soil sampling device and autonomous picking device and method. The method solves the problem of intelligent management of crop cultivation and picking, and is applied to the field of artificial intelligence agriculture.

title: Remote and autonomous control picking, processing and conveying device and method
abstract: In order to solve the problems of heavy physical labor and low picking operation efficiency, the remote and autonomous controlled picking device is adopted to realize remote and autonomous controlled fruit picking, and the device comprises an autonomous picking device, a radar autonomous navigation device, a moving device, a multi-sensing device and a conveyor belt, the invention discloses a light processing device, which effectively realizes the integration of autonomous identification of plants and maturity thereof, positioning of plants, picking, light processing, packaging, conveying and storage, solves the problem of intelligent management of crop picking, and is applied to the field of artificial intelligence agriculture.

title: Automatic feeding equipment for agriculture and animal husbandry for artificial intelligence
abstract: The utility model discloses an automatic feeding device for artificial intelligence agriculture and animal husbandry, a plurality of feeding basins are installed on a base, a first motor is installed in the base, a connecting rod is installed at the upper end of an output shaft, the axis of the connecting rod and the axis of the output shaft are collinear, the upper end of the connecting rod is fixedly connected with a connecting box, and the connecting box is fixedly connected with the base. A push plate mechanism is installed in the connecting box, a material mixing box is welded to the upper portion of the connecting box, feeding pipes are arranged on the two opposite sides of the material mixing box, the lower ends of the feeding pipes communicate with the material mixing box, a mixing mechanism is installed on the material mixing box, and a quantifying mechanism is connected to the outer side of a connecting rod. According to the artificial intelligence automatic feeding equipment for agriculture and animal husbandry, a second motor is arranged to be matched with a rotating shaft to achieve the effect of rotating and mixing different feeds for stirring spoons, and the stirring spoons are irregularly mounted on the outer side of the rotating shaft, so that the feed mixing effect of the equipment is improved; by arranging the mechanism, the livestock can eat uniformly mixed feed.

title: Moistureproof Internet of Things storage cabinet
applicants: GUANGZHOU AIRICE ECOLOGICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE CO LTD
abstract: The utility model discloses a moistureproof internet of things storage cabinet, including cabinet body, drying subassembly and data subassembly, the casing of cabinet body includes a pair of outer casing and inner casing that are arranged in parallel, the drying subassembly includes drying filter element and fan, the drying filter element is vertically arranged in the circulation chamber of cabinet body both sides, and the fan is arranged in the circulation chamber of cabinet body both sides. An opening is formed in the bottom of the inner cavity, the fan is arranged in the opening in the bottom of the inner cavity, and the data assembly comprises a temperature sensor and a processing center; according to the storage cabinet, moisture prevention and drying of the interior of the storage cabinet are achieved through the arrangement of the drying assembly, meanwhile, real-time remote monitoring of the humidity in the storage cabinet is achieved through the arrangement of the data assembly, the environment humidity in the storage cabinet can be controlled through the mobile terminal, use is more convenient and reliable, and humidity control is more accurate and timely.

title: MULTI-DIMENSION ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE ADVISOR
abstract: A method, a computer system, and a computer program product for a multi-dimension artificial intelligence (AI) agriculture advisor is provided. Embodiments of the present invention may include creating a user profile. Embodiments of the present invention may include preparing and transforming the external data. Embodiments of the present invention may include conducting a hypothesis on the transformed data. Embodiments of the present invention may include validating the transformed data. Embodiments of the present invention may include training an artificial intelligence (AI) model based on the transformed data. Embodiments of the present invention may include validating and retraining the artificial intelligence (AI) model. Embodiments of the present invention may include matching the user data with the artificial intelligence (AI) model. Embodiments of the present invention may include ranking results based on the matching the user data with the artificial intelligence (AI) model.

title: Rice disease type identification method based on deep residual convolutional neural network
applicants: GUANGZHOU AIRICE ECOLOGICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AGRICULTURE CO LTD
abstract: The invention provides a rice disease type identification method based on a deep residual convolutional neural network, and is applied to the field of computer vision. The method comprises the following steps of forming disease recognition training data by acquiring disease rice photo data and receiving data annotation of a user on a disease rice photo; zooming a diseased rice picture according todifferent proportions, and mixing the zoomed diseased rice picture with an original diseased rice picture to improve robustness of the model; and associating a preset rice color value weight ratio with disease category labels in the disease identification training data, thereby training a rice disease identification model through the disease identification training data and the example data. Thenatural law that diseases have certain color value difference is utilized, and the rice color value weight ratio and the disease data are associated to serve as priori knowledge, so that the early disease recognition rate of the rice is increased.

title: Agricultural intelligent platform based on Internet of Things
applicants: HUNAN FENGMAO PLANT PROT MACHINERY CO LTD
abstract: The utility model relates to the field of agricultural management, in particular to an agricultural intelligent platform based on the Internet of Things, which comprises an IaaS module, a PaaS moduleand an SaaS module, the IaaS module is connected with the PaaS module, and the PaaS module is connected with the SaaS module; the IaaS module comprises an Internet of Things base station, an agricultural sensor and an insect condition acquisition device, and the agricultural sensor and the insect condition acquisition device are connected with the Internet of Things base station through adapters and transmit data to the Internet of Things base station; the PaaS module comprises a data processing module and an artificial intelligence module, and the data processing module is connected with theartificial intelligence module; the SaaS module comprises a user processing module, and a user manages the platform through the user processing module. Artificial intelligence agriculture can be comprehensively achieved, labor force is reduced, production cost is saved, grain quality safety is improved, and agricultural intellectualization is achieved.

title: Artificial intelligence agriculture activity recording system
Automatic animal medicated bath device for livestock farm
applicants: XINJIANG KENMAITE BIOLOGICAL TECH CO LTD
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of farm automation equipment, in particular to a farm automation animal medicated bath device. According to the automatic animal medicated bath device for the livestock farm, the lifting hanging basket is arranged in the medicated bath pool, when the automatic animal medicated bath device is used, an animal to be subjected to medicated bath is firstly driven into the hanging basket, then the hanging basket is lowered, the animal is lowered into the medicated bath pool to be subjected to medicated bath, and the automatic animal medicated bath device has the advantages of being good in medicated bath effect, saving workers and saving time and labor. Meanwhile, part of medicated bath liquid medicine can be recycled at the water control position, and the advantage of saving materials is achieved.

title: Automatic equipment for chicken farm
applicants: GUANGXI GUILYUFENG AGRICULTURE AND ANIMAL HUSBANDRY TECH CO LTD
abstract: The utility model discloses chicken farm automation equipment which comprises a rectangular bottom plate, rectangular positioning columns are fixedly connected to the two ends of the top of the rectangular bottom plate respectively, the sides, close to each other, of the two rectangular positioning columns are slidably connected with the same rectangular storage box, rectangular box doors are installed on the two sides of the rectangular storage box respectively, and the rectangular box doors are matched with the rectangular storage box. A rectangular connecting block is mounted at the top of the rectangular positioning column, an alarm is mounted at the top of the rectangular connecting block, rectangular mounting blocks are fixedly connected to the two sides of the rectangular positioning column, a cylindrical rotating rod penetrates through one side of each rectangular mounting block and is rotationally connected with the rectangular mounting block, and a telescopic rod is mounted in the center of the top of the rectangular bottom plate; the top of the telescopic rod is connected with the bottom of the rectangular storage box, and by arranging the rectangular groove block, the rectangular storage box can conveniently slide in the rectangular groove opening through the rectangular groove block, so that the sliding stability of the rectangular storage box is improved, the working efficiency is improved, and the practicability is improved.

title: Management Apparatus System and Method for measuring quality of water based on internet of things
abstract: The present invention relates to an Internet of things (IoT)-based water quality measurement and management apparatus, system, and method to receive water quality data from a water purification system and provide the received data through a water quality management service application of a user terminal. According to the present invention, the IoT-based water quality measurement and management apparatus comprises: a water quality data acquisition unit acquiring water quality data required for water quality management from a water purification system; and a water quality data delivery unit providing the water quality data acquired by the water quality data acquisition unit through a water quality management service application operated on a user terminal possessed by a water purification system manager. Accordingly, the water quality data required for seawater management is provided the manager in real-time, a farm's shipping time can be adjusted and farm automation can be implemented.

title: Robot cleaning control system
applicants: GUANGDONG NANMU MACHINERY & EQUIPMENT CO LTD
abstract: The utility model relates to a robot cleaning control system which comprises a robot body, a trolley controller, a mechanical arm controller, a sensor assembly and a mechanical arm assembly. The trolley controller and the mechanical arm controller are arranged in the robot body. The mechanical arm assembly is arranged on the upper portion of the robot body. The trolley controller is connected with the mechanical arm controller and the sensor assembly, and the mechanical arm controller is connected with the mechanical arm assembly; the trolley controller determines a moving route and a working site through the sensor assembly, and controls the robot body to move to the working site according to the moving route; and the mechanical arm controller executes cleaning operation at the working site. Movement control over the robot body is achieved through the trolley controller, the mechanical arm assembly is controlled through the mechanical arm controller to conduct cleaning after the robot body reaches a working site, manual work can be replaced to conduct corresponding cleaning tasks in a large-scale farm, automation of cleaning in the farm is achieved, and the cleaning efficiency is improved. And the cleaning efficiency in the field is greatly improved.

title: Automatic equipment for chicken farm
applicants: HUGUAN GENGYUN AGRICULTURAL TECH CO LTD
abstract: The utility model discloses chicken farm automation equipment, and particularly relates to the technical field of breeding devices, the chicken farm automation equipment comprises a chicken raising frame cage, an automatic feeding mechanism is arranged at the top end of the chicken raising frame cage, and a quantitative water outlet cleaning mechanism is arranged on one side of the chicken raising frame cage; the automatic discharging mechanism comprises a supporting flat plate, a movable groove is formed in one side of the supporting flat plate, and a transmission lead screw is arranged in the movable groove. By arranging the automatic discharging mechanism and the quantitative water outlet cleaning mechanism, rapid and quantitative discharging is achieved, manual discharging operation is not needed, the discharging speed is effectively increased, time and labor are saved, convenience and rapidness are achieved, the discharging uniformity and flatness are kept in the discharging process, the feeding ranges of all chickens are the same, and the feeding efficiency is improved. The double functions of tap water are achieved, meanwhile, the water consumption can be controlled, in this way, use of water resources is effectively improved, water resource waste caused by the problems that the water resources are too clean and excessive drinking overflows is avoided, and more resources are saved.

title: Smart Farm Automation Equipment of hydroponics Plant
abstract: The present invention relates to smart farm automation equipment for hydroponic plants, capable of automating an entire process of transferring a seedling distribution port to a tray by cutting a sponge seedling mat through a robot arm unit.

title: Vertical Farming System for Multi-Cultural Cultivation and its Vertical Farming Automation System
abstract: The present invention relates to a vertical farm system for multi-variety cultivation and a vertical farm automation system for multi-variety cultivation. The present invention comprises a first tray mounting and transferring device and a plurality of trays. The first tray mounting and transferring device comprises: a first frame comprising four vertical bars having a predetermined height, four horizontal bars in the longitudinal direction having a predetermined length and four horizontal bars in the width direction having a predetermined length; and a plurality of tray transfer guide members having a length corresponding to the horizontal bar in the longitudinal direction and having a rail part formed in the longitudinal direction, wherein a plurality of the tray transfer guide members are installed in parallel with the horizontal bar in the longitudinal direction at a predetermined interval from the top to the bottom inside the two vertical bars on the left side of the first frame so that the rail part faces inward, and a plurality of tray transfer guide members at positions facing each of the plurality of tray transfer guide members on the left inside the two vertical bars on the right are installed so that the rail part faces inward/ The plurality of trays have a predetermined width and have a length in which both ends can be placed on the rail part of the tray transfer guide member facing each other on the left and right sides of the tray mounting and transferring device, and are transferred by an external force while both ends are placed on the rail part of the tray transfer guide member.

title: A SYSTEM AND A METHOD FOR PROVIDING USERS WITH ACCESS TO SERVICES RELATED TO FARMING AND FARM AUTOMATION
abstract: A SYSTEM AND A METHOD FOR PROVIDING USERS WITH ACCESS TO SERVICES RELATED TO FARMING AND FARM AUTOMATION A method for providing users with access to services related to farming and farm automation comprises steps of receiving a request from a first computing device (1021) of a first plurality of computing devices (102) associated with farmers, for services related to farming and farm automation, receiving one or more bids from the first plurality of computing devices (102), a second plurality of computing device (104) and/or a third plurality of computing devices (106), in response to the request, depending upon a type of service required, selecting at least one bid using the first computing device (1021), from received one or more bids, verifying a quality of one or more products being provided as a part of the service, based on the selection of the at least one bid and providing a quality assurance certificate and facilitating the completion of the service to the first computing device (1021) after successful verification. [FIGURE 1] ILI 104 1 0 l106 Processing Qualityverification module Module

title: Automatic milking equipment
abstract: The invention discloses an automatic milking equipment, which belongs to the technical field of dairy farm automation equipment and comprises a turntable, a plurality of dairy cow accommodating unitsare arranged on the turntable along the circumferential direction of the turntable, a milking robot comprises an arc guide sliding rail, the arc guide sliding rail and the turntable are coaxially arranged, the lower part of a telescopic mechanism is slidably mounted on the arc guide slide rail, a six-axis cooperative robot body is installed at the output end of the telescopic mechanism, the telescopic mechanism drives the six-axis cooperative robot body to be close to or away from the turntable, a transverse moving mechanism is arranged on the side, away from the turntable, of the arc guide sliding rail, one end of a flexible connecting mechanism is installed at the output end of the transverse moving mechanism, the other end of the flexible connecting mechanism is rotationally connected with the bottom of the telescopic mechanism, the moving direction of the transverse moving mechanism is perpendicular to the moving direction of the telescopic mechanism, a milk cup storage mechanism is arranged between the turntable and the milking robot, and the milking robot grabs milk cups from the milk cup storage mechanism and places the milk cups to the nipples of dairy cows. The milking equipment can conduct automatic milking operation on dairy cows.

title: Milk cup storage mechanism
abstract: The invention discloses a milk cup storage mechanism, which belongs to the technical field of dairy farm automation equipment. The milk cup storage mechanism comprises a milk cup storage rack; the cupmouth of a milk cup is downwardly and vertically placed on the milk cup storage rack; the milk cup storage mechanism is characterized in that a traction mechanism is arranged on one side of the milkcup storage rack; an air cylinder is vertically arranged on a traction rack; the traction mechanism comprises the traction rack, a fixed pulley and a movable pulley; both an air pipe connector and a milk pipe connector are arranged on the upper end face of the traction rack; the fixed pulley is rotationally arranged on the upper portion of the traction rack; a movable pulley support is connected with a cylinder rod of the air cylinder; the movable pulley is rotationally arranged on the movable pulley support; the air cylinder drives the movable pulley to move vertically; an air pipe is connected into the air pipe connector sequentially through a vacuum connector of the milk cup, the fixed pulley and the movable pulley; and a milk circulation pipe is connected into the milk pipe connector sequentially through a milk channel connector of the milk cup, the fixed pulley and the movable pulley. The milk cup in the milk cup storage mechanism has a relatively large movement stroke; and therefore, the milk cup storage mechanism is suitable for being matched with a mechanical arm to carry out automatic milking operation on dairy cows.

title: A system and a method for providing users with access to services related to farming and farm automation
abstract: A method for providing users with access to services related to farming and farm automation comprises steps of receiving a request from a first computing device (1021) of a first plurality of computing devices (102) associated with farmers, for services related to farming and farm automation, receiving one or more bids from the first plurality of computing devices (102), a second plurality of computing device (104) and/or a third plurality of computing devices (106), in response to the request, depending upon a type of service required, selecting at least one bid using the first computing device (1021), from received one or more bids, verifying a quality of one or more products being provided as a part of the service, based on the selection of the at least one bid and providing a quality assurance certificate and facilitating the completion of the service to the first computing device (1021) after successful verification.

title: A SYSTEM AND A METHOD FOR PROVIDING USERS WITH ACCESS TO SERVICES RELATED TO FARMING AND FARM AUTOMATION
abstract: A method for providing users with access to services related to farming and farm automation comprises steps of receiving a request from a first computing device (1021) of a first plurality of computing devices (102) associated with farmers, for services related to farming and farm automation, receiving one or more bids from the first plurality of computing devices (102), a second plurality of computing device (104) and/or a third plurality of computing devices (106), in response to the request, depending upon a type of service required, selecting at least one bid using the first computing device (1021), from received one or more bids, verifying a quality of one or more products being provided as a part of the service, based on the selection of the at least one bid and providing a quality assurance certificate and facilitating the completion of the service to the first computing device (1021) after successful verification.

title: SMART FARM AUTOMATION SYSTEM USING ROBOT
abstract: The present invention relates to a smart farm automation system utilizing a robot. In the smart farm automation system utilizing the robot according to an embodiment of the present invention, a plurality of racks are configured in a cultivation space provided for cultivating crops, and beds configured for cultivating crops are configured for each floor in the rack, so that water supply and drainage carry out by moving through an unmanned truck, and thus the robot is utilized to deliver crops for stocking and harvesting seedlings. Therefore, by effectively controlling and automating the growth environment necessary for the cultivation of crops by a rack unit, it is possible to easily cultivate various crops regardless of a place.

title: Automatic feed supply apparatus and house stable automatic system
abstract: The present invention relates to an automatic functional feed supply apparatus and an on-ground house type livestock farm automation system. According to the present invention, the automatic functional feed supply apparatus includes: a feed tank which is filled with feed and has a feed discharging unit arranged on a side of the lower end for discharging the feed; a cover for opening or closing the feed tank; a pad which is arranged between the feed tank and the tank cover; an outlet door which is arranged on the feed discharging unit and opens or closes the same; a feed tray which is formed on the lower part of the feed discharging unit and stores the feed dropped through the feed discharging unit; a functional cover which is coupled to the feed tank, is arranged in an opening position in a feed supply mode to grant access to the feed tray to the livestock, and is arranged on the closing position in a feed supply stop mode to prevent the inflow of manure or foreign substances into the feed tray; and a cover operation unit operating the functional cover.

title: LED FARM AUTOMATION SYSTEM THAT MONITORS PLANT GROWTH ENVIRONMENT AND CONTROLS LED LIGHTING
applicants: INDUSTRY ACADEMIC COOPERATION FOUNDATION OF KYUNGWOON UNIV [KR]
abstract: The present invention relates to a farm automation system. In particular, the farm automation system comprises: a sensor module, an analysis module, a control module, a monitoring module, and a transmitting and receiving module for wireless communications among the sensor module, the analysis module, the control module, and the monitoring module. According to the present invention, the farm automation system can manage plant growth environments in real time and increase energy efficiency, thus reducing the costs for running and managing a plant factory.

title: Farm Automatic Devices
abstract: A farm automation device is disclosed. An embodiment of the present invention provides the farm automation device for automating the existing farm facility. The farm automation device is connected to a control target device installed in a farm to collect sensor information from a sensor and to control the control target device by an automatic control algorithm. To this end, the farm automation device comprises a sensor receiving unit, an algorithm receiving unit, a control unit, a mode switch, and a casing.

title: ANIMAL DRINKING DEVICES
FARM AUTOMATION SYSTEM
abstract: The invention relates to a farm automation system comprising a farm computer for controlling processes at the farm such as milking and feeding of the animals and/or for building up a data file with animal data relevant to the farm, such as eating behavior, milk yield, temperature and milk resistance. The system further comprises speech synthesis means for transmitting information from the farm computer by means of speech, and speech recognition means for transmitting information to the farm computer by means of speech.

title: FARM-AUTOMATION GROWING DEVICE
abstract: An automated device for cultivating agricultural products having a cultivation board in a stepwise manner to enable automatic transfer of the cultivation board is provided to enhance ease of working and administration and reduces labor costs and maintenance costs. An automated device for cultivating agricultural products comprises: A-shaped two frames(10) connected with a plurality of chain gears(32) and mounted with a chain(30); a cultivation board(20) formed with a drain outlet(22) at the bottom and containing a connection part(24) at both side parts to connect with the chain; a driving device containing a drive motor, a drive gear fixed to the drive gear, a driven gear and a drive shaft and installed at the central lower part of two frames; a water supply part containing a water feed pipe(62) and an injection nozzle(64); a power supply part to supply power to the driving device and water supply part; and a control part to control the driving device, water feed part and power supply part. The driven gear is positioned at the center from the length of the drive shaft. The cultivation board is transferred by the driving of the driving device.

title: FLOW CONTROL VALVES
IMPROVED ANIMAL DRINKING DEVICE
abstract: 1,249,996. Valves. FARM AUTOMATION Ltd. 23 Sept., 1969 [25 Sept., 1968], No. 45498/68. Heading F2V. An animal drinking device comprises a body member 1 formed with a valve seat 6, a valve member 8 formed with a valve head 7 adapted to co-operate with the valve seat 6, and a valve stem 3a extending through a bore 2 so that tilting of the stem relative to the bore allows liquid to flow through the device, and wherein the body member is shaped relative to the bore so that the mouth of an animal can apply pressure between the stem 3a and the body 1. The asymmetry may be derived from a stepped portion (Fig. 2, not shown) or a slotted portion (Fig. 3, not shown) of the body 1. The valve stem may be in the form of a tube (Fig. 4, not shown) through which the animal receives the water.

title: Improvements in flow control valves
abstract: 1,063,960. Valves. FARM AUTOMATION Ltd. Aug. 25, 1965 [Sept. 24, 1964], No. 39050/64. Heading F2V. A valve, e.g. for supplying livestock with liquid, is operated by relative tilting or axial displacement between valve stem 3 and body member 1 to unseat closure 4 and is provided with means to restrict the relative tilting to prevent opening in at least one direction so that e.g. the device may be used with the stem in a non-vertical position. The valve may also be opened by relative axial displacement against the spring 8 and, in one embodiment, is provided with a hollow drinking cup 5 through an opening 6 whereof the liquid is supplied to the animal's mouth. In an alternative embodiment (Figs. 4 and 5, not shown), the cup (5) is omitted and the valve is actuated directly from an axially projecting portion (3b) of the stem (3). The through bore in the body member 1 opens out from a relatively small cross-section at the end 2b, which may be longitudinally grooved to provide additional flow, to a larger cross-section 2c to accommodate the tilting. The tilting may be restricted in one direction by a stop comprising a transverse screw intersecting the bore, a segment-shaped plug inserted in the bore or a flat (10) (Fig. 2, not shown) formed on one side of the bore or the tilting may be restricted to one direction only by forming the bore as an elongated slot of the width of the stem (3) (Fig. 2a, not shown). The bore (2d) adjacent the valve seat (Figs. 4 and 5, not shown) may also be eccentric to the larger bore (3b) to provide the restriction to tilting. The stem (3) may additionally be provided with a tapered portion (11) in the region 2b of the bore adjacent the seat (Fig. 3, not shown) so that the through flow may be varied upon axial displacement of the stem. In a float operated tank supply valve (Fig. 6, not shown), a lip (15) of the float (13) shrouds the end of the body member (11) and tilting is restricted upwardly by any of the previously mentioned means, so that the valve remains closed when the tank is full, and the bore (2<SP>1</SP>) may be tapered. The float valve construction provides a " snap " closing action.

title: Perfectionnements aux soupapes de commande de circulation
Ventil mit einem kippbaren Abschlussglied
Farm automation system
METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR AUTONOMOUS INDOOR FARMING.
abstract: An autonomous farming system includes a computing device that is configured to obtain plant characteristic data that characterizes one or more plant characteristics of a plant growing in at least one growing module. The computing device is further configured to determine at least one growing deficiency of the plant based on the plant characteristic data using a farming engine and to send at least one farming action to a farming controller operatively coupled to the at least one growing module. The at least one farming action includes a remedial action to improve growing conditions of the plant.

title: VIRTUAL SAFETY BUBBLES FOR SAFE NAVIGATION OF FARMING MACHINES
abstract: An autonomous farming machine navigable in an environment for performing farming action(s) is disclosed. The farming machine receives a notification from a manager that there are no obstacles in the blind spots of the detection system. The farming machine applies an obstacle detection model to the captured images to verify that there are no obstacles in unobstructed views. The farming machine determines a configuration of the farming machine. The farming machine determines a virtual safety bubble for the farming machine to autonomously perform the farming action(s) based on the determined configuration. The farming machine detects an obstacle in the environment by applying the obstacle detection model to the captured images. The farming machine determines that the obstacle is entering the virtual safety bubble. In response to determining that the obstacle is entering the virtual safety bubble, the farming machine terminates operation of the farming machine and/or enacts preventive measures. title: Potato planting automatic drip irrigation device based on environmental analysis
abstract: The invention discloses an automatic drip irrigation device for potato planting based on environmental analysis, and relates to the technical field of potato planting. According to the method, environmental factors are taken as basic data reference to calculate irrigation amounts required in different time periods and different production periods, a wireless data transmission technology is combined, an irrigation amount calculation model is established on a remote terminal, variables of the calculation model are mainly conversion factors of different environmental factors, and the conversion factors are used for calculating the irrigation amounts. The method aims at liberating a traditional farming irrigation mode of manual operation, forming an autonomous farming irrigation mode of adjusting measures to local conditions, adjusting measures to time and conditions, and enabling potatoes to obtain sufficient and effective'production 'planning from a seedling raising period to a fruiting period.

title: VIRTUAL SAFETY BUBBLES FOR SAFE NAVIGATION OF FARMING MACHINES
abstract: An autonomous farming machine navigable in an environment for performing farming action(s) is disclosed. The farming machine receives a notification from a manager that there are no obstacles in the blind spots of the detection system. The farming machine applies an obstacle detection model to the captured images to verify that there are no obstacles in unobstructed views. The farming machine determines a configuration of the farming machine. The farming machine determines a virtual safety bubble for the farming machine to autonomously perform the farming action(s) based on the determined configuration. The farming machine detects an obstacle in the environment by applying the obstacle detection model to the captured images. The farming machine determines that the obstacle is entering the virtual safety bubble. In response to determining that the obstacle is entering the virtual safety bubble, the farming machine terminates operation of the farming machine and/or enacts preventive measures.

title: MACHINE-LEARNED TILLAGE MALFUNCTION DETECTION IN AN AUTONOMOUS FARMING VEHICLE
abstract: A detection system (210) detects malfunctions in an autonomous farming vehicle during an autonomous routine using one or more models and data from sensors (220) coupled to the autonomous farming vehicle. The models may include machine-learned models (310) trained on the sensor data and configured to identify objects indicative of an operational or malfunctioning component within a tilling assembly such as a tilling shank (350) or sweep (360). Additionally, a machine-learned model may be trained on sensor data to detect whether debris has plugged the tilling assembly of the autonomous farming vehicle (370). In response to detecting a malfunction or a plug, the detection system may modify the autonomous routine (e.g., pausing operation) or provide information for the malfunction to be addressed (e.g., the likely location of a malfunctioning sweep that has detached from the tilling assembly).

title: AUTONOMOUS FARMING GROWTH CONTROL AND MAINTENANCE SYSTEMS
abstract: In some embodiments, the present disclosure pertains to methods and systems for optimizing a property of a plant. In some embodiments, the methods of the present disclosure include: (1) receiving one or more growth-related parameters of the plant; (2) receiving one or more phenotype-related parameters of the plant; (3) receiving one or more qualitative parameters of the plant; (4) utilizing a computing unit to evaluate said one or more growth-related parameters, phenotype-related parameters and qualitative parameters of the plant; and (5) utilizing the computing unit to adjust the one or more of the growth-related parameters of the plant based on the evaluation. In some embodiments, the aforementioned steps are repeated a plurality of times. In some embodiments, the parameters are stored in a database and utilized by a machine-learning algorithm to optimize the evaluation of the parameters and adjustment of the growth-related parameters.

title: Calibration of autonomous farming vehicle image acquisition system
abstract: A system and a method are disclosed for calibrating an image acquisition system of a farming machine. The farming machine captures images of objects in an environment as the farming machine moves through an environment. Based on the captured images, a represented three-dimensional (3D) model of the environment representing the objects in a three-dimensional space is generated. From the represented 3D model, a represented location of an object (e.g., building, lamppost, tree) is determined. The represented location of the object is compared to a reference location of the object and the comparison is used to calibrate the image acquisition system by modifying positions, orientations, or optical settings of one or more cameras in the image acquisition system.

title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR AUTONOMOUS INDOOR FARMING
abstract: An autonomous farming system includes a computing device that is configured to obtain plant characteristic data that characterizes one or more plant characteristics of a plant growing in at least one growing module. The computing device is further configured to determine at least one growing deficiency of the plant based on the plant characteristic data using a farming engine and to send at least one farming action to a farming controller operatively coupled to the at least one growing module. The at least one farming action includes a remedial action to improve growing conditions of the plant.

title: AUTONOMOUS FARMING DEVICES, SYSTEMS AND METHODS
inventors: SCOTT-ROBINSON NEMO KENNETH JAMES WILLIAM HARRY [GB]
abstract: Methods, systems 1 and devices such as robots 8, 9 for farming are disclosed. An autonomous monitoring robot is configured to traverse a farm plot and generate, from a sensor set of the monitoring robot, a farm plot data set. The farm plot data set is processed to generate operating instructions for a tending robot. The tending robot is arranged to execute the operating instructions so as to traverse the farm plot and performs tending tasks on it including such as seed-planting, weeding, and applying crop treatments such as fertiliser, fungicide, herbicide or pesticide.

title: AUTONOMOUS ROBOT SYSTEM FOR STEEP TERRAIN FARMING OPERATIONS
abstract: An autonomous farming system (26) comprising one or more ground-based drones (10) and one or more unmanned aerial vehicles (12), whose routes through a field are optimized by an autonomous farming control system (30) that utilizes linearly constrained integer quadratic programming. The farming system (26) is particularly suited for farming steep terrain that is not accessible to conventional farming equipment.

title: Smart farming robot
abstract: 본 발명은 스마트 그린 파밍 농업 로봇에 관한 것으로서, 적재면의 수평을 자유롭게 유지하면서도 경작지를 자율주행할 수 있는 스마트 그린 파밍 농업 로봇에 관한 것이다. 이를 위해 농작업을 위해 작업자가 올라가거나 또는 농작업용 운반물이 놓이는 적재부, 수평 유지부에 의해 각각 독립적으로 제어됨으로써 적재부의 수평을 유지 하고, 각각의 암이 감속 구동 모터에 연결되어 제어되는 복수의 암부, 복수의 암부와 연결 접속되어 전자제어 조향부의 조향에 따라 방향 이동하는 주행부, 충전에 의해 전원을 공급하는 배터리부, 농작업을 위해 제어되며, 농약 살포시에 하측방향에서 상측방향으로 농약이 살포되도록 제어하는 로봇 팔, 농기구와 기계적으로 연결 접속되어 농기구를 견인하는 견인부, 토양 측정 센서를 농토에 침투시켜 토질을 측정하는 토양 측정부, 로봇 팔의 제어에 따라 하측에서 상측방향으로 농약이 살포됨으로써 잎의 뒷면에 농약이 살포되도록 하는 농약 살포부, 스피커를 통해 음향을 송출하거나 또는 지향성 스트로브를 통해 접근하는 야생동물에 경고함으로써 인근의 야생동물을 퇴치하는 야생동물 퇴치부, 제어에 의해 촬영 각도 내의 영상을 획득하는 카메라부, 외부의 단말기와 통신함으로써 원격 제어가 가능하도록 하는 원격 통신부, 배터리부에 저장된 배터리의 충전 용량을 체크하여 기 설정값 이하시에 정해진 위치로 이동하여 배터리를 충전하도록 하고, 각종 센서로부터 취합된 센서 데이터를 분석함으로써 스마트 그린 파밍이 가능하도록 하는 제어부가 개시된다.

title: DME DME REFORMING SYSTEM FOR SMART FARMING AND POWER PLANT
abstract: 본 발명은 스마트 농장 및 발전소를 위한 DME 개질 시스템에 관한 것으로, DME(dimethyl ether)를 원료로 이산화탄소와 수소를 생산하여 스마트 농장에 비료와 전기에너지를 공급하고, DME 개질 과정에서 환경 오염물질의 발생, 특히 C02의 발생을 최소화한 스마트 농장 및 발전소를 위한 DME 개질 시스템을 제공하기 위한 것이다.

title: DEVICE FOR PROTECTING WILDLIFE DURING NIGHT PICKING WITH A HARVESTING MACHINE AND OTHER AGRICULTURAL TASKS
abstract: The present invention relates to a device (1) for protecting wildlife during night picking with a harvesting machine and other agricultural tasks, comprising sources (4) of diffused light (2) connected to the harvesting machine (3).

title: LIVESTOCK RESTRAINING DEVICES, SYSTEMS FOR LIVESTOCK MANAGEMENT, AND USES THEREOF
abstract: Tools for smart farming, including devices, management systems and methods of livestock management are provided.

title: Edge and Cloud Computing based Smart Farming System using Bluetooth Hybrid Topology
abstract: 본 발명은 블루투스 하이브리드 토플로지를 활용한 엣지 클라우드 컴퓨팅 기반 스마트팜 시스템 및 동작 방법에 관한 것으로서, 일실시예에 따른 엣지 클라우드 컴퓨팅 기반 스마트팜 시스템은 작물 레시피에 따라 작물의 환경을 조절하는 엣지 디바이스에 대한 파라미터를 저장하고, 상기 엣지 디바이스에 대한 파라미터를 제어하기 위한 제어 명령을 전송하는 클라우드, 상기 제어 명령에 대응하여 동기화된 시간을 기준으로, 상기 엣지 디바이스가 상기 제어 명령에서 정해진 순서에 따라 동작하도록 제어하는 제어 메시지를 전송하는 스타 디바이스, 상기 제어 메시지를 기반으로 상기 동기화된 시간을 기준으로 동작하면서 상기 제어 메시지를 브로드캐스팅하는 노드 디바이스, 및 상기 노드 디바이스로부터 수신된 상기 제어 메시지를 기반으로 상기 동기화된 시간을 기준으로 작물 레시피를 구현하기 위해 상기 파라미터를 조절하는 엣지 디바이스를 포함할 수 있다.

title: The Platform and method of Smart Farming Foundry
abstract: 본 발명은 온라인 스마트팜플랫폼과 오프라인 파운드리플랫폼을 융합한 것으로 좀더 구체적으로는 일정규모의 작물재배용 파운드리 시설단지 중앙부에 영농기술과 작물재배정보 및 작물생장필요물질을 공급하는 바이오캠프를 설치하여 경작자들의 시설투자 중복을 피하고 ICT기술과 IoT설비의 고도한 자동제어로 관리되는 쾌적한 작물재배환경에서 위생적인 농산물을 생산하게 함으로써 스마트 영농설비의 상용화와 대중화를 촉진하고, 생산된 농산물의 판매와 물류의 애로를 극복하도록 생산자와 소비자를 직접 연결하는 리빙로지스 애플리케이션을 통하여 신선한 로컬푸드의 유통과 물류를 해결하는 스마트영농파운드리 플랫폼과 그 방법을 제시하는 것이다.

title: Smart farming system using scouting drone and autonomous robot
abstract: 본 발명은 스마트 농업 시스템에 관한 것이며, 보다 상세하게는 스카우팅 드론과 오토 로봇을 이용한 스마트 농업 시스템에 관한 것이다. 본 발명에 의해 농작업지에 맞는 기후정보와 작물 현황에 관한 데이터를 지속적으로 수집한 다음 필요한 농작업을 수행하는 오토 로봇을 투입하여 계절 및 상황에 맞는 농작업을 자동화할 수 있다.

title: METHOD FOR IMPROVING REPRODUCTIVE PERFORMANCE IN FEMALE OF MAMMALS USING ULTRA WEAK PHOTON
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for improving reproductive ability in female mammals by using ultraweak photons. In the method for improving reproductive ability in female mammals by using ultraweak photon according to the present invention, light in the visible light band is used, but is transmitted in a weak form that is not visually perceptible, so it does not cause stress and allows safe irradiation for a long time, thereby improving the reproductive ability of female mammals. Conventional methods of feeding substances to improve reproductive ability are supplied in a consumptive manner, causing environmental pollution problems due to resistance and misuse. On the contrary, the method of the present invention is a useful alternative technology that can be used for a long time and ensures the sustainability of livestock farming. Accordingly, the method is a simple, practical, and eco-friendly method that can be applied to smart farming to safely improve the reproductive ability of female mammals. Therefore, farm productivity can be significantly improved.

title: Smart Farming solar power system
abstract: The present invention relates to a smart agricultural solar power generation system. The smart agricultural solar power generation system comprises: a solar structure for solar power generation; a rail installed in an area where the solar structure is installed; and a farm machine that can move on the rail. Therefore, the smart agricultural solar power generation system can increase a utilization degree of the area where the solar structure is installed.

title: AN IOT BASED SMART FARMING MANAGEMENT SYSTEM IN THE STATE OF ODISHA
applicants: KALINGA INSTITUTE OF INDUSTRIAL TECH KIIT [IN]

title: A VIRTUAL INTERFACING SYSTEM TO TRAIN FARMERS FOR SMART FARMING AND A METHOD THEREOF

SHELVING FOR SOILLESS CULTIVATION, UNIT PARTICULARLY INTENDED TO BE INCLUDED IN SUCH SHELVING, SOILLESS CULTIVATION MODULE COMPRISING SUCH A UNIT, AND SOILLESS CULTIVATION SYSTEM COMPRISING AT LEAST TWO OF SUCH SHELVING
abstract: Shelving (200) for soilless cultivation, comprising at least one first row (201) and one second row (201), each row (201) comprising at least one cultivation unit (300), each cultivation unit (300) comprising at least one cultivation compartment (307), the shelving further comprising a device (202) for moving the two rows (201) with respect to one another in such a way that the shelving (200) can adopt two configurations: —an open configuration in which the growing media (308) are accessible from an aisle (203) between the two rows (201); —a closed configuration in which the cultivation compartments (307) form at least one cultivation chamber (204), the shelving (200) further comprising a sealing system (205) that limits the exchanges of air between the cultivation chamber (204) of the shelving (200) in the closed integration and the outside.

title: METHOD FOR IMPROVING REPRODUCTIVE PERFORMANCE IN MALE OF MAMMALS USING ULTRA WEAK PHOTON
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for improving reproductive potential of male mammals using ultra-weak light. According to the present invention, the ultra-weak light is light in a visible band, but is transmitted in a weak form is not visually recognized, so that the ultra-weak light can be emitted safely for a long time without stress, thereby improving reproductive potential of male mammals. Unlike existing reproductive potential improvement material feeding methods are exhaustive and cause environmental pollution problems due to resistance and abuse, the method is a useful alternative technology capable of ensuring sustainability of the livestock industry while being used for a long time. Accordingly, the method can be applied to smart farming in a simple, practical, and eco-friendly method to safely improve the reproductive potential of male mammals, thereby significantly increasing productivity of farms.

title: Multi-layered Smart Farming Device
abstract: The present invention is a smart aquaculture apparatus capable of aquaculture of various fish species. The smart aquaculture apparatus comprises: an apparatus main body providing a space for aquaculture; a water tank unit installed in a multi-layered manner in a part of the apparatus main body to accommodate cultured fish species; a pair of fixed frames forming side surfaces of the apparatus main body, fixed at a position where the water tank unit is set, and having an inflow passage and a drain passage, respectively; an accommodating chamber constituting a lower portion of the apparatus main body, fixing the pair of fixed frames, and accommodating water which is received or drained from the water tank unit; and a controller provided in a portion of the apparatus main body and connected to the accommodating chamber to control the operation of the accommodating chamber.

title: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR SMART FARMING
abstract: The invention provides a computer implemented method for mapping a geographical boundary of an agricultural area (140) within an agricultural region (110). The method includes obtaining location data by way of a handheld mobile device (150) comprising a location data unit and deriving one or more geographical coordinates based on the location data. A map (170) of the agricultural region is obtained and the one or more geographical coordinates are mapped to the map of the agricultural region. A geo-fence (180) representing a boundary of an agricultural area is generated based on the one or more mapped geographical coordinates. The mapped geolocation coordinates are used to combine disease identification data collected via the device with satellite meteorological and other data to calculate and predict disease spread.

title: Soilless culture rack, unit intended in particular to be incorporated in such rack, soilless culture module incorporating such unit, and soilless culture system incorporating at least two such racks
abstract: A soilless culture rack (200) comprising at least a first row (201) and a second row (201), each row (201) comprising at least one cultivation unit (300), each cultivation unit (300) comprising a frame (301) framing at least one cultivation compartment (307), the rack further comprising means (202) for moving the two rows (201) relative to each other such that the rack (200) can assume two configurations: an open configuration, wherein the cultivation compartment (307) of each unit (300) of the first row (201) is separated from the cultivation compartment (307) of each unit (300) of the second row (201) by an open air circulation channel (203) from which the growth medium (308) enters; a closed configuration in which the opening (306) of each unit (300) of the first row (201) is in communication with the opening (306) of at least one unit (300) of the second row (201) such that the cultivation compartments (307) share and form at least one cultivation chamber (204), the rack (200) further comprising a sealing system (205) which limits air exchange between the cultivation chamber (204) of the rack (200) in the closed configuration and the outside.

title: LIVESTOCK RESTRAINING DEVICES, SYTEMS FOR LIVESTOCK MANAGEMENT, AND USES THEREOF
abstract: Tools for smart farming, including devices, management systems and methods of livestock management are provided.

title: SHELVING FOR SOILLESS CULTIVATION, UNIT PARTICULARLY INTENDED TO BE INCLUDED IN SUCH SHELVING, SOILLESS CULTIVATION MODULE COMPRISING SUCH A UNIT, AND SOILLESS CULTIVATION SYSTEM COMPRISING AT LEAST TWO OF SUCH SHELVING
abstract: Shelving (200) for soilless cultivation, comprising at least one first row (201) and one second row (201), each row (201) comprising at least one cultivation unit (300), each cultivation unit (300) comprising at least one cultivation compartment (307), the shelving further comprising a device (202) for moving the two rows (201) with respect to one another in such a way that the shelving (200) can adopt two configurations: - an open configuration in which the growing media (308) are accessible from an aisle (203) between the two rows (201); - a closed configuration in which the cultivation compartments (307) form at least one cultivation chamber (204), the shelving (200) further comprising a sealing system (205) that limits the exchanges of air between the cultivation chamber (204) of the shelving (200) in the closed integration and the outside.

title: LIGHT EMISSION AND DETECTION IN A LIDAR SYSTEM
abstract: A LIDAR system including an optical system (101) is provided, the optical system (101) including: a light source (102); an optical component (104) comprising a plurality of segments (106-1... 106-8) to deflect the light emitted by the light source (102) towards a field of view (108) of the LIDAR system in a plurality of respective emission directions (114); and a controller (112) to control a continuous movement of the optical component (104), in such a way that the light emitted by the light source (102) impinges onto a different segment during different portions of the continuous movement of the optical component (104). The optical system (101) may include a detector (126) to detect light. The optical component (104) may include a plurality of receive optical elements (128-1... 128-8), each associated with a respective segment. A receive optical element may be disposed relative to the associated segment in such a way that a direct reflection (114r) of the emitted light deflected by the segment impinges onto that receive optical element. The light detection may be understood as a tracking of a scanned horizontal and vertical angle range through an optical tracking filter to increase the signal- to-noise ratio. The optical component may be implemented as a hard disk drive including a rotating disk onto which light emitted by a light source may be directed. The LIDAR system may be part of a vehicle or of a smart farming or of an indoor monitoring system.

title: IOT BASED OPTIMAL MANAGEMENT OF SMART FARMS USING WIND POWER SYSTEM
abstract: IOT BASED OPTIMAL MANAGEMENT OF SMART FARMS USING WIND POWER SYSTEM Renewable energy system has found its application in several fields as an alternative to conventional energy source. This invention focuses on investigation of off-grid renewable wind power for the optimal management of smart farms. This work deals with designing a real time renewable wind power system along with its storage to meet the needs of smart farms. Wireless monitoring system is involved in smart farms along with actuators where robotic devices continuously monitor the crop condition without human intervention. Power requirements of such smart farms must be uninterrupted and has to be of low cost. The designed system is able to generate clean wind energy to be utilized for farming process such as irrigation as well as for the sensors and the actuators involved in the smart farms. Prototype of the proposed system is implemented for validating the system, which shows the design is able to provide sufficient power for the optimal management of the smart farm independent on the availability of utility power grid. Figure 1. Prototype of Proposed Smart Farming System Based on loT Motor 2 Figure 2. Schematic of Wind Turbine Powered Smart Farm System

title: Systems and methods for smart farming
abstract: A computer implemented method 200 for mapping a geographical boundary of an agricultural area within an agricultural region. The method includes obtaining location data 210 by way of a mobile computing device having a global positioning unit such as a GPS, the location data relating to the global position of the mobile computing device; deriving geographical coordinates based on the location data 230; obtaining a map of the agricultural region 240 and mapping the one or more geographical coordinates to the map 250; and defining a geo-fence representing a boundary of an agricultural area based on the one or more mapped geographical coordinates 260. The mobile computing device may include an imaging unit such as a camera for obtaining image data representative of a crop or livestock within the area. The device may generate an identity tag based on an identified crop or livestock and map the identity tag to the map of the region. The device may also identify a crop or livestock disorder, such a crop disease or pest, based on the image data; generate an identity tag based on the crop disorder; and map the identity tag to the map of the region.

title: AI-BASED CROP RECOMMENDATION SYSTEM FOR SMART FARMING TOWARDS AGRICULTURE 5.0
abstract: AI-BASED CROP RECOMMENDATION SYSTEM FOR SMART FARMING TOWARDS AGRICULTURE 5.0 According to a report of the Food and Agriculture Organization, the world population is projected to increase another two billion by 2050, while the arable region is expected to only grow by 5%. To increase productivity in agriculture, clever and effective agricultural techniques are therefore required. The determination of land adequacy for agriculture is a basic instrument for the growth of agriculture. Agriculture is using many emerging technologies and inventions as an approach to the gathering and distribution of agricultural knowledge. The rapid growth of wireless sensor networks has led to the creation of Internet of Things (IoT) of low cost and compact sensor devices, which are a feasible method for automating and making decisions in agriculture. This study proposes an expert framework for the evaluation of agricultural land suitability, by combining sensor networks with artificial intelligence systems such as neural networks and multi-component perceptron. This innovation would help farmers determine the farmland for agriculture according to four classes of judgment, i.e. more acceptable, suitable, reasonably appropriate and unsuitable. This measurement is based on the data from the different sensor instruments used for machine training. The results achieved by MLP with four hidden layers are seen in contrast to the other current model, to be successful for the multiclass classification system. This learned model is used to evaluate potential evaluations and to identify the land after each harvest. IIPage Al-BASED CROP RECOMMENDATION SYSTEM FOR SMART FARMING TOWARDS AGRICULTURE 5.0 Diagram: Sensors Software AJ data set Impie ents Figure 1: Flow network for Al based crop management system

title: SMART FARMING
abstract: A vehicular control system includes sensors such as IoT (internet of things) sensors that can share data with other vehicles and that can communicate with the cloud to provide intelligent handling of the irrigation system.

title: Air purifier using plants without roots
abstract: The present invention relates to an air purifier using a rootless plant. According to the present invention, the air purifier using a rootless plant comprises: a smart farming system including an ultraviolet ray generator, a humidity controller, and a temperature measuring device; an air ventilation system; and an interface and operation unit. According to the present invention, the problem of dust being generated when a conventional air purifier using a plant is used can be resolved.

title: VARIABLE CONTROL PERFORMANCE EVALUATION DEVICE FOR AGRICULTURAL DRONES
applicants: REPUBLIC KOREA MAN RURAL DEV ADMIN [KR]
abstract: 본 발명은 농업용 드론의 방제 성능 평가 장치에 관한 것으로, 본 발명의 일양태에 따르면 농업용 드론의 가변 방제 성능 평가 장치가 제공되고, 이 장치는, 액체와 반응하는 감수지가 제공되고 감수지를 이동시키기 위한 컨베이어부; 컨베이어부의 상측에 농업용 방제 드론을 고정하기 위한 드론 고정부; 상기 컨베이어부의 일측에 제공되어 드론에 의해 살포된 액체와 반응한 후의 감수지를 촬영하기 위한 영상획득부; 및 상기 영상획득부로부터 획득된 영상을 분석하여 드론에서 살포된 액체의 분사량과 분사 패턴을 분석하고 획득된 분사량과 분사패턴으로부터 드론의 방제 성능을 평가하는 제어부;를 포함하고, 상기 제어부는 사용자에 의해 입력된 드론의 비행 프로파일 속도에 대응하여 상기 컨베이어부의 이동 속도를 조절하도록 구성된다.

title: .Information collection device and information collection method for agricultural drones.
abstract: 본 발명은 농업용 드론에 관한 것으로, 좀 더 구체적으로 설명하면 농업용 드론의 수행정보를 일관되게 수집 보관할 수 있게 지원하는 농업용 드론의 정보수집장치에 관한 것이다.

title: Spreader installed on agricultural drones that generate strong wind
abstract: The present invention relates to a spreader installed in an agricultural drone that generates and uses strong winds, comprising: a case (100); a propeller (110) installed inside an upper part of the case (100); a motor (120) installed under the propeller (110); a connection part (130) installed under the motor (120); and a spraying part (140) installed below the connection part (130). The present invention can be installed and used on drones operated on the ground or in the air, and also has a simple operation method, so that there is a remarkable effect that users can use the spreader easily.

title: AGRICULTURAL CROP ANALYSIS DRONE
abstract: A method and system utilizing one or more agricultural drones in combination with agricultural equipment, e.g., an agricultural boom sprayer, to evaluate the crops being farmed, and to improve the real-time delivery and dispensing of liquid from the sprayer including monitoring and verifying that the liquid is being dispensed correctly and/or in accordance with a desired distribution pattern or level.

title: System of operate agricultural drones
abstract: The present invention relates to an agricultural drone operation system and collects various information on agricultural areas through monitoring drones, derives a schedule for management drones using the collected information, and manages the agricultural areas, and thus the present invention is more systematic than the prior art and can be operated to immediately cope with climate change in the agricultural areas.

title: SYSTEM FOR MANAGEMENT AND CONTROL OF AGRICULTURAL DRONES
abstract: The present invention can provide an agricultural drone system for pest control, which comprises: a receiving unit installed in the front portion of a cargo box of a truck; and a drone seating unit installed in the rear portion of the receiving unit in the cargo box of the truck. The drone seating unit comprises: a sliding part installed on a bottom surface of the cargo box, wherein a rail is installed along the length in the front and rear direction on an upper surface of the sliding part; and a station installed to slide in the front and rear direction along the rail on an upper side of the sliding part, wherein the drone can be seated on an upper surface of the station.

title: DISTRIBUTING SYSTEM USING AGRICULTURAL DRONES
abstract: According to one embodiment of the present invention, a method of controlling an agricultural sprinkling system includes the steps of: enabling an agricultural sprinkling system control server to receive work information including at least one between remaining battery information and remaining sprinkled material information included in a first drone and movement information including at least one between movement pattern information and position information of the first drone from the first drone which is sprinkling a sprinkled material; enabling the server to calculate a predicted work stop timing of the first drone based on the work information; enabling the agricultural sprinkling system control server to calculate a predicted work stop position of the first drone based on the movement information and the predicted work stop timing information of the first drone; enabling the agricultural sprinkling system control server to transmit a movement request including the predicted work stop position information and the predicted work stop timing information of the first drone to a second drone; and enabling the agricultural sprinkling system control server to request the second drone to start to sprinkle the sprinkled material from an actual work stop position of the first drone in accordance with an actual work stop timing of the first drone when the first drone stops sprinkling. Therefore, the method is capable of increasing the efficiency of sprinkling a sprinkled material by automating a shift of drones for battery charging.

title: DISTRIBUTING SYSTEM USING AGRICULTURAL DRONES
abstract: According to the present invention, a method of controlling an agricultural sprinkling system includes the following steps of: enabling an agricultural sprinkling system control server to request an agricultural sprinkling drone to move to a sprinkled material sprinkling target area; enabling the server to receive display unit information, including the designated sequence and position of each display unit received by the drone from a plurality of display units spaced apart from each other along the circumference of the sprinkling target area, from the drone moving to the sprinkling target area; enabling the server to request the drone to move to the position of a first display unit of the plurality of display units, which is the closest to the drone, based on the display unit information; enabling the server to calculate sprinkling target area information including shape and area information of the sprinkling target area based on the display unit information, and then, set a route for the drone to sprinkle the sprinkled material equally throughout the sprinkling target area based on the sprinkling target area information; and enabling the server to request the drone moved to the position of the first display unit to sprinkle the sprinkled material while moving along the route. Therefore, the method is capable of setting a route for a drone to efficiently sprinkle a sprinkled material in response to a sprinkling target area having various shapes.

title: DISTRIBUTING SYSTEM USING AGRICULTURAL DRONES
abstract: A control server for controlling an agricultural spray system according to an embodiment of the present invention includes: a memory in which a program for controlling an agricultural spray system is stored; and a processor for executing the program stored in the memory. The processor, according to the execution of the program, sets mixing information of an object to be sprayed including a raw material, a mixing ratio and weight of the object to be sprayed based on spray information of the object to be sprayed, which includes at least one of a kind of a target crop to which a preset object to be sprayed is sprayed, a spray purpose of the object to be sprayed, an area of a place where the object to be sprayed is sprayed, and a spray position. A first mixed object to be sprayed is prepared by mixing the object to be sprayed based on the mixing information of the object to be sprayed by controlling a spray object mixing module based on the preset mixing information of the object to be sprayed. By controlling a spray object packing module, the first mixed object to be sprayed, which is prepared from the spray object mixing module, is stored in a first cartridge based on drone information including the remaining battery capacity received from a drone such that the first mixed object to be sprayed has a set weight. The first cartridge is placed in a first region on a predetermined station, and upon receiving a request to provide the first cartridge from the drone, the station is controlled, so that the first region in which the first cartridge is disposed is placed in a loading area where the drone is waiting to mount a mixed object cartridge.

title: Agricultural drones with support and safety guards for Collision damage
abstract: The present invention relates to an agricultural control drone, which sprays agricultural pesticides for aerial control and prevents damage to a fuselage when generating accidents and additional damage thereby from being generated, and more specifically, an agricultural control drone with a safety device, which installs a support unit installed in a round shape so as to support a guard unit on a guard member capable of absorbing impact when colliding with people or a structure during agricultural pesticides spraying operation and improving stability and prevents damage by contact of a propeller unit and accidents from being generated.

title: AGRICULTURAL DRONE FOR USE IN LIVESTOCK FEEDING
abstract: A method and system utilizing one or more agricultural drones for real-time monitoring, delivery and dispensing of feed in feed bunks associated with feed lots.

title: UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLE CONTROL METHOD AND GROUND CONTROL TERMINAL
abstract: An unmanned aerial vehicle control method and a ground control terminal, the method comprising: acquiring information of an unmanned aerial vehicle (S101); and sending the information to a remote server via a wireless communication device (41) so that the remote server monitors the unmanned aerial vehicle in real time according to the information (S102). The method realizes communication of the ground control terminal (40) with the remote server via the wireless communication device (41) in real time by providing the wireless communication device (41) in the ground control terminal (40) for controlling the unmanned aerial vehicle; the remote server can monitor the unmanned aerial vehicle in real time, especially for agricultural drones which has a larger body, and is of a high price. The real-time monitoring of agricultural drones can ensure the safety of agricultural drones.

title: Agricultural drone convenient to carry
applicants: ZHONGSHAN RNICE COMMERCIAL RESIDENTIAL ELECTRICAL APPLIANCE CO LTD
abstract: The invention discloses an agricultural drone convenient to carry, and relates to the technical field of agricultural drones. The agricultural drone comprises a retraction box and a pesticide spray tank; retractable sleeves are slidingly connected in the retraction box through slide grooves, and one side of each retractable sleeve penetrates through the retraction box and extends to the outside ofthe retraction box; supporting rods are slidingly connected in the retractable sleeves, rotating blocks are rotationally connected to the ends, away from the retractable sleeves, of the supporting rods, rotating sleeves are rotationally connected to one sides of the rotating blocks through connecting rods, blades are fixedly installed on the two sides of each rotating sleeve, and threaded pins are in threaded connection with the portions, under the rotating blocks, of the bottoms of the supporting rods. According to the agricultural drone convenient to carry, the retractable sleeves can be retracted into the retraction box through the slide grooves, and the supporting rods can be retracted into the retractable sleeves through the retractable sleeves, so that the overall area of the equipment is reduced, the occupied space is small, the equipment is convenient to transport and carry, and the blades are not prone to damage.

title: Agricultural drone spraying control system based on Beidou ground based enhancement system and Internet of things
abstract: The invention discloses an agricultural drone spraying control system. The system comprises a plurality of agricultural drones, agricultural drone control terminals, an agricultural drone management center and a user mobile terminal; each agricultural drone control terminal is used for controlling a plurality of agricultural drones of a local area network to which the corresponding agricultural drone control terminal belongs; the user mobile terminal is used for initiating a spraying request to the agricultural drone management center and configuring and uploading spraying parameters to a spraying information database, and feeding back confirmation information to the agricultural drone management center after the agricultural drone management center accepts the request and the mounting ofan agricultural drone selected by a user is ready; the agricultural drone management center is used for sending the ID information of the selected agricultural drone and the spraying parameters to theagricultural drone control terminals; and the agricultural drone control terminal is used for controlling the selected agricultural drone to perform spraying operation. With the agricultural drone spraying control system of the invention adopted, the automation of spraying in agricultural production can be realized, and convenience can be enhanced for farmers in using drones.
