title: Monitoring system of crop growth environment based on drone
applicants: GUANGDONG RONGQE INTELLIGENT TECH CO LTD
abstract: The invention discloses a monitoring system of the crop growth environment based on a drone, and relates to the technical field of agricultural drones. The system comprises a drone and a remote management platform. The drone comprises a holder-carrying camera, an infrared thermal imaging module, a navigation module, a soil nutrient sensor and a PH tester. The holder-carrying camera and the infrared thermal imaging module are used for shooting crops and recording imaging information of the crops. The navigation module is used for adding and numbering position information of each crop. The soil nutrient sensor is used for detecting content conditions of soil nutrients in a certain range of the place where the crops are cultivated. The PH tester is used for detecting the PH value of the soil of the region where the crops are cultivated. The remote management platform comprises an image analysis module. Information transmitted by the drone is analyzed and combined through the image analysis module. According to the invention, the system facilitates knowing of growth conditions of the crops; irrigation and fertilization are properly selected to be performed on the crops; and nutrients required by the growth of the crops are timely supplemented.

title: Agricultural Drone for Use in Controlling the Direction of Tillage and Applying Matter to a Field
abstract: A method and system utilizing one or more agricultural drones to improve the monitoring, measuring and mapping of a field in order to produce contour maps that will be used in working a field, in particular, controlling a direction of tillage and/or controlling the spreading of matter (e.g., fertilizer, manure or sewage treatment sludge) across the field while preventing undue erosion and/or runoff.

title: METHOD FOR SCHEDULING AND DISPLAYING THREE-DIMENSIONAL ANNOTATIONS
applicants: GUANGXI ZHUANG AUTONOMOUS REGION NATURAL RESOURCES REMOTE SENSING INST [CN]
abstract: A method for scheduling and displaying three-dimensional annotations is provided, relating to the field of realistic three-dimensional visualization technology. The present disclosure covers data services, data scheduling schemes, data storage schemes, annotation avoidance schemes, and annotation efficient display schemes. Users can use this disclosure to schedule and display massive three-dimensional annotations in WebGL at high frame rates while consuming extremely low performance. It solves the problem of text inversion and non-hierarchical zooming of three-dimensional maps in traditional annotation and slicing services which can cause text to appear larger or smaller, breaking through the technical bottleneck that traditional annotation and slicing services that cannot be superposition displayed on 3D models. By using this disclosure, massive annotation data can be displayed without slicing, and rich annotation styles can be customized and displayed by users, providing a more advanced annotation display solution for realistic three-dimensional visualization technology.

title: HIGH-RESOLUTION CARBON MONITORING SATELLITE BASED ON LINEAR VARIABLE FILTER
abstract: A high-resolution carbon monitoring satellite (9) based on a linear variable filter (3). The carbon monitoring satellite (9) runs on a low earth orbit, and a carbon monitoring spectrometer loaded on the carbon monitoring satellite (9) is used for performing high-resolution remote sensing detection on a terrestrial target and atmosphere of a designated area (11), so as to quantitatively monitor carbon source information and carbon sink information, wherein the high resolution comprises a hyperspectral resolution and a high spatial resolution in the case of the hyperspectral resolution. The carbon monitoring satellite (9) establishes an imaging attitude on the orbit, the carbon monitoring spectrometer acquires two-dimensional spatial information and hyperspectral radiance information by performing push-broom scanning on the designated area (11), and a terrestrial application system generates a hyperspectral data cube on the basis of the acquired two-dimensional spatial information and hyperspectral radiance information of the designated area (11); and quantitative inversion is performed on the basis of the hyperspectral data cube, such that the carbon source information and the carbon sink information of the designated area (11) are acquired.

title: DICTIONARY BASED TEMPORALLY COMPRESSED SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR IMAGE RECONSTRUCTION
abstract: This disclosure relates generally to Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) reconstruction and finds wide application in remote sensing. Conventional approaches either involve huge computational requirement for processing or require specialized hardware along with many additional Radio Frequency (RF) components. The present disclosure provides two approaches for temporally sampling a received pulse compressed signal at two sub-sampling factors, wherein both methods involve frugal hardware implementation. Reconstruction approach of the art is based on the principle of difference ruler and is not suitable for SAR image reconstruction due to the large measurements and image dimensions. In accordance with the present disclosure, the reconstruction problem is framed as an inverse imaging problem by suitably using a forward model and employing an approach like Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) for solving this model which allows use of readily available Plug and Play (PnP) priors.

title: VEGETATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AND VEGETATION MANAGEMENT METHOD
abstract: A vegetation management system 1 comprises: a vegetation classification unit 13 that classifies vegetation imaged in remote sensing data; a long-term change prediction unit 15 for predicting a long-term wide-area fluctuation that is a vegetation range fluctuation in a predetermined long-term time series on the basis of the classification result of the vegetation and the remote sensing data; a short-term change prediction unit 16 for predicting a short-term wide-area fluctuation that is a vegetation range fluctuation in a predetermined short-term time series on the basis of the classification result of the vegetation and the remote sensing data; a risk determination unit 17 for determining a risk due to contact between the vegetation and a facility on the basis of the prediction result by the long-term change prediction unit 15 and the prediction result by the short-term change prediction unit 16; and a visualization unit 18 for visualizing the determination result of the risk.

title: SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING METHOD BASED ON HIGH-SPATIAL-RESOLUTION SATELLITE
abstract: The present invention provides a surface water quality monitoring method based on a high-spatial-resolution satellite, for use in efficiently and conveniently measuring the water quality of target water. The surface water quality monitoring method comprises: Step 1, building a surface water quality standard pool and obtaining surface water quality data, the surface water quality standard pool comprising: a standard pool A used for containing clear water, a standard pool B used for containing natural water, and standard pools C-E used for containing three types of mixed water which are formed by mixing the clear water and the natural water and in which the proportions of the clear water are respectively n1, n2, and n3; Step 2, acquiring a high-spatial-resolution remote sensing image, and processing same; Step 3, performing correlation analysis on remote sensing image data wave bands and a preset proportion value for the surface water quality standard pool to identify a remote sensing wave band having high correlation; Step 4, establishing a water quality parameter inversion model, and performing comparison inversion on the remote sensing wave band having high correlation and the surface water quality data to obtain water quality data; and Step 5, obtaining a water quality anomaly point on the basis of the surface water quality data and a water quality data threshold value.

title: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR FUSION AND CLASSIFICATION OF REMOTE SENSING HYPERSPECTRAL IMAGE AND LASER RADAR IMAGE
abstract: The present invention relates to a method for fusion and classification of a remote sensing hyperspectral image and a laser radar image, comprising: acquiring a hyperspectral image and a laser radar image; performing intrinsic image decomposition on the hyperspectral image to obtain an intrinsic image and an illumination image, and for each hyperspectral intrinsic pixel, each hyperspectral illumination pixel, and each laser radar pixel, selecting neighborhood blocks thereof; training a plurality of deep network branches by using the neighborhood blocks; splicing outputs of the plurality of deep network branches in pairs by using a splicing layer; and performing multi-modal fusion on spliced outputs to obtain a final output category. According to the method for fusion and classification of the remote sensing hyperspectral image and the laser radar image provided by the present invention, important discrimination information in a multi-source remote sensing image can be fully fused, thereby achieving the objective of high-precision classification of target pixels, and missing and loss of important information during fusion are fully avoided, thereby reducing the problems of classification precision reduction and the like caused by information loss.

title: A Method Based on Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Remote Sensing for Monitoring Cotton Health
abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of cotton health monitoring, and discloses a method based on unmanned aerial vehicle remote sensing for monitoring cotton health , which comprises the following steps: Step 1: Firstly, install the monitoring device; Step 2: Then, the monitoring device is controlled by the pan-tilt, so that the monitoring device reaches the cotton planting area, and the cotton is photographed and detected by the monitoring device; Step 3: Controlling the monitoring device to reach the designated place through the pan/tilt, and recycling the monitoring device; Step 4: Compare and verify the data of the photos taken by the monitoring device to confirm whether the cotton in this area is healthy or not. Accord to that invention, the cotton in the same area is simultaneously detected by the remote sen unmanned aerial vehicle and the remote control vehicle, so that the upper side and the inner part of the cotton leaves can be obtain at the same time, and the leaves and rhizomes shielded by the uppermost cotton leaves can also be observed.

title: REMOTE SENSING IMAGE OVERALL PLANNING RECOMMENDATION METHOD BASED ON CONTENT UNDERSTANDING
applicants: BEIJING DATA INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION TECH CO LTD [CN]
abstract: Disclosed in the present invention is a remote sensing image overall planning recommendation method based on content understanding. The method comprises the following steps: S1, acquiring a query condition and a first image set; S2, acquiring depth features of the first image set; S3, acquiring local features of the first image set; S4, acquiring fusion features of the first image set; S5, acquiring fusion feature similarities among images in the first image set; S6, selecting an initial image from the first image set, and determining optimal indexes, the optimal indexes comprising a feature similarity and an effective coverage rate; S7, using the initial image as a root node, performing split expansion for multiple times from the root node according to the optimal indexes to obtain a complete split search tree, and obtaining a second image set on the basis of the split search tree; and S8, recommending the second image set to a user. According to the method, the fusion feature similarities of image sets and the effective coverage rates of images are used as optimal indexes to perform split tree search, such that an image set to be recommended can be rapidly acquired.

title: TELEMETRY METHOD AND SYSTEM BASED ON USER CONTENT
abstract: Disclosed in the present invention is a telemetry method based on user content. The method comprises: collecting user content information on a forwarding plane, analyzing the user content information on the basis of a remote sensing target to generate first analysis user content, and storing the first analysis user content; analyzing the first analysis user content on a control plane on the basis of remote sensing monitoring to generate second analysis user content; by means of the second analysis user content, determining a message in which telemetry data needs to be inserted, generating user content to be forwarded, and issuing same to the forwarding plane; and according to a preset telemetry table, the forwarding plane inserting the telemetry data into the user content to be forwarded, so as to realize telemetry. According to the method and the system of the present invention, a network can be monitored from the perspective of content service, and a user does not need to worry that telemetry information is inserted into all messages of user content information, so that unnecessary network overhead is prevented from being increased.

title: OPTICAL FIBER SENSING SYSTEM, HOST SENSING DEVICE, REMOTE SENSING DEVICE, SENSING METHOD, AND SENSING DEVICE CONTROL METHOD
abstract: The optical fiber sensing system includes: a host sensing device including a first optical sensor for receiving, from a first optical fiber, first light corresponding to first pulse light input into the first optical fiber and first signal light and outputting first data for the first optical fiber corresponding to the first light and second data included in the first signal light, and a first data communicator for outputting a data signal including the first data and second data; and a remote sensing device including a second optical sensor for receiving, from a second optical fiber, second light that corresponds to second pulse light input into the second optical fiber and outputting second data including sensing results for the second optical fiber corresponding to the second light, and a second data communicator for outputting, to the first optical fiber, first signal light including the second data.

title: MODULAR PAYLOAD DEVICE FOR AN UNMANNED AIRCRAFT
abstract: The invention proposes a modular payload device for an unmanned aircraft provided with a body made up of a plurality of guides, rods, frames provided with guiding recesses, coupling elements, and longitudinal members linked to a printed circuit board (PCB) formed by connectors and power regulators for connecting flight and payload instruments, wherein the frames are fixed to the body by means of introducing the rods through perforations made on the frames, whereas the coupling elements and the anchoring means are linked with the complementary anchoring means by tongue and groove clipping. Advantageously, the electric circuit of the PCB allows the integration and synchronization of sensors for remote sensing.

title: Spectral Differential Equation Approximation Method for Mixed Potential Green's Function in Multilayered Media
abstract: The invention provides a method to compute the mixed potential contributions to electric and magnetic field in multilayered media, which can be applied in microwave engineering, integrated circuit analysis, and remote sensing. The Spectral Differential Equation Approximation Method (SDEAM) for solving Michalski-Zheng's mixed-potential Green's functions in fully shielded, partially open, and fully open multilayered media are described. The main advantage of SDEAM over other methods is that for a fixed location of the source elevation z′, it does not require fitting from scratch for every z, z′, and ρ combination. Because of this advantage, SDEAM can be superior in both performance and accuracy to other existing methods. The well-established boundary value problem numerical solvers also provide SDEAM with robustness for miscellaneous planar multilayered structures.

title: LAMINATED GLASS AND VEHICLE.
abstract: Provided is a laminated glass capable of allowing light radiated from a remote sensing device to pass therethrough well and of improving the heat insulation properties.ã¿¿A laminated glass according to the present invention includes a first laminated-glass member, a second laminated-glass member, and an interlayer, wherein the interlayer is disposed between the first laminated-glass member and the second laminated-glass member, the light transmittance of the first laminated-glass member is 85% or higher at all wavelengths within the range from 380 nm to 2500 nm, the laminated glass has a first region and a second region, and the light transmittance in the second region is at least 5% higher than the light transmittance in the first region, at at least one wavelength within the range from 380 nm to 2500 nm.

title: METHODS AND SYSTEMS FOR SENSING A ROAD SURFACE
abstract: An example system for remote sensing of a road surface includes an antenna configured to transmit and receive radiofrequency (RF) signals, where the antenna is configured to attach to a front end of a vehicle; at least one radiofrequency identification (RFID) tag, where the at least one RFID tag is configured to attach to the front end of a vehicle; and an RFID reader, wherein the RFID reader is configured to: cause the antenna to transmit a radiofrequency signal toward a road surface, where the at least one RFID tag receives a backscattered RF signal from the road surface; receive, from the antenna, an RFID signal from the first RFID tag, the RFID signal comprising phase and magnitude information; and analyze the phase and magnitude information to determine a condition of the road surface.

title: Systems and Methods For Multispectral Landscape Mapping
abstract: Image acquisition and analysis systems for efficiently generating high resolution geo-referenced spectral imagery of a region of interest. In some examples, aerial spectral imaging systems for remote sensing of a geographic region, such as a vegetative landscape are disclosed for monitoring the development and health of the vegetative landscape. In some examples photogrammetry processes are applied to a first set of image frames captured with a first image sensor having a first field of view to generate external orientation data and surface elevation data and the generated external orientation data is translated into external orientation data for other image sensors co-located on the same apparatus for generating geo-referenced images of images captured by the one or more other image sensors.

title: NMF REMOTE SENSING IMAGE UNMIXING METHOD AND SYSTEM BASED ON RANK-ORDER LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD CONSTRAINTS
abstract: The present invention relates to the field of remote sensing image processing and provides an NMF remote sensing image unmixing method and system based on rank-order local neighborhood constraints, including S1: obtain hyperspectral data, initialize the hyperspectral data through VCA-FCLS to obtain an initial endmember matrix and an initial abundance matrix, using the initial endmember matrix as the current endmember matrix and the initial abundance matrix as the current abundance matrix; S2: Update the current endmember matrix and current abundance matrix to obtain the updated endmember matrix and abundance matrix; S3: If the maximum number of iterations is reached or the error is less than the specified threshold, the updated endmember matrix and updated abundance matrix are output. Otherwise, return to S2 with the updated endmember matrix as the current endmember matrix and the updated abundance matrix as the current abundance matrix. The present invention can effectively reduce the errors generated in calculating spatial distance weight and has a positive effect on improving the accuracy of unmixing.

title: PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING AGRICULTURAL MEASURES
abstract: The present invention relates to the planning and implementation of agricultural measures using remote sensing data and local field data. Using remote sensors, the total required amount and partial-area-specific required amounts of plant protection agents and/or nutrients and/or seeds and/or the like can be determined, and based on this information, the use of an application device can be planned. Using local field sensors, the current local required amounts in the field are determined so that the application device can apply the corresponding amounts as required.

title: PHOTOACOUSTIC REMOTE SENSING (PARS), AND RELATED METHODS OF USE
abstract: A photoacoustic remote sensing system (PARS) for imaging a subsurface structure in a sample, comprising one or more laser sources configured to generate a plurality of excitation beams configured to generate pressure signals in the sample at an excitation location, and a plurality of interrogation beams incident on the sample at the excitation location, a portion of the plurality of interrogation beams returning from the sample that is indicative of the generated pressure signals, an optical system configured to focus the plurality of excitation beams at a first focal point and the plurality of interrogation beams at a second focal point, the first and second focal points being below the surface of the sample, and a plurality of detectors each configured to detect a returning portion of at least one of the plurality of interrogation beams.

title: GENERATING HIGH-RESOLUTION CONCENTRATION MAPS FOR ATMOSPHERIC GASES USING GEOGRAPHY-INFORMED MACHINE LEARNING
abstract: Generating one or more high-resolution atmospheric gas concentration maps using geography-informed machine learning includes obtaining a remote sensing dataset constrained by at least one temporal window and at least one spatial window defining a first geographic area. The remote sensing dataset includes at least a first set of atmospheric gas concentration data for a plurality of atmospheric gases. A training dataset is generated based on the remote sensing dataset. A machine learning model is trained with the training dataset to predict a plurality of atmospheric gas concentration values for at least one atmospheric gas of the plurality of atmospheric gases in a given geographic area and with a spatial resolution that is greater than a spatial resolution of atmospheric gas concentration data provided as an input to the machine learning module.

title: METHOD FOR QUANTIFYING THE EXTENT AND RECURRENCE OF NATURAL EVENTS
abstract: A method for quantifying the extent and recurrence of a predetermined natural event, such as a flooding event, in a geographical area, in particular in spite of the absence of reliable data from sensors on the ground where the natural event develops. The method relies on remote sensing data, such as satellite imagery, and data processing, and reaps the benefits of computational models based on accurate remote sensing of the area under consideration.

title: GENERATING HIGH-RESOLUTION CONCENTRATION MAPS FOR ATMOSPHERIC GASES USING GEOGRAPHY-INFORMED MACHINE LEARNING
abstract: A geography-informed machine learning (GIML) model is trained on a first remote sensing dataset corresponding to a first geographic area and including a first set of atmospheric gas concentration data for at least one atmospheric gas, a first set of multispectral data, and a first set of spatially autocorrelated land use classifications. The GIML model receives input including a second remote sensing dataset corresponding to a second geographic area. The second remote sensing dataset includes a second set of atmospheric gas concentration data for the atmospheric gas, a second set of multispectral data, and a second set of spatially autocorrelated land use classifications. The GIML model generates, for the second geographic area, a plurality of predicted atmospheric gas concentration values for the atmospheric gas having a spatial resolution that is greater than a spatial resolution of the first and second sets of atmospheric gas concentration data.

title: Water surface monitoring device based on remote sensing
applicants: WUHAN LESHUI SHUZHI TECH CO LTD
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of water surface monitoring devices, and discloses a water surface monitoring device based on remote sensing, which comprises a main body mechanism, a starting mechanism and a lifting mechanism, the starting mechanism is positioned in the main body mechanism, the lifting mechanism is positioned in the main body mechanism, and the lifting mechanism comprises a main rod, a gear II and an anchor, the second gear is fixedly installed at the outer end of the main rod, and the anchor is movably installed at the outer end of the main rod. According to the remote sensing water surface monitoring device, through installation of a main body mechanism, after the remote sensing water surface monitoring device reaches the water surface needing to be detected, when a second gear rotates forwards, a main rod is driven to rotate leftwards, meanwhile, an anchor descends along with the main rod, interference caused by wind can be resisted at the moment, and when a user needs to take back the remote sensing water surface monitoring device, the second gear rotates reversely to drive the main rod to rotate rightwards; and meanwhile, the anchor can rise along with the anchor, and the user can remotely control the anchor to be withdrawn, so that the practicability of the remote sensing water surface monitoring device is effectively improved.

title: Remote sensing surveying and mapping positioning device
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of remote sensing surveying and mapping, and discloses a remote sensing surveying and mapping positioning device, which is characterized in that two ends of a guide rod are respectively and fixedly connected with a first mounting frame and a second mounting frame, the guide rod is provided with a trimmer, the trimmer is provided with a remote sensing positioning transceiver, and the trimmer comprises a first threaded rod, a fastening seat and an adjusting seat; the first threaded rod is sleeved with a fastening seat in a threaded mode, an adjusting seat is fixedly connected to the top of the fastening seat, a groove is formed in the top of the adjusting seat, and a limiting block is slidably connected into the groove. The fine tuning device can transversely and longitudinally adjust the position of the remote sensing positioning transceiver, so that the remote sensing positioning transceiver can still actually adjust the position of the remote sensing positioning transceiver after being fixed, the adjustment work can be completed without pulling out the insertion rod again, and the adjustment precision of the first threaded rod and the second threaded rod is high. The remote sensing positioning transceiver can be adjusted to a designated area more conveniently, meanwhile, adjustment is more time-saving and labor-saving, and actual surveying and mapping positioning work cannot be affected.

title: Big data collection sensor overload protection device
abstract: The utility model discloses an overload protection device for a big data collection sensor, which relates to the technical field of sensor load protection devices, and comprises two connecting plates, the middle positions of the upper surfaces of the two connecting plates are provided with connecting brackets, and the connecting brackets are connected with the connecting plates. The outer side ends of cushioning plates are arranged above the front ends and the rear ends of the two connecting plates correspondingly, cushioning rubber balls are arranged between the outer side ends of the cushioning plates and the connecting plates correspondingly, clamping seats are arranged at the inner side ends of the cushioning plates, connecting pipes are clamped and fixed into the clamping seats, distance fixing rods are arranged at the front ends and the rear ends of the connecting pipes, and the distance fixing rods are connected with the connecting pipes. A traditional sensor load protection device for remote sensing big data collection is replaced, the whole protection device is designed to be of a split structure, vibration transmission between assemblies is reduced, the buffering effect is better when an unmanned aerial vehicle lands, and the safety of the unmanned aerial vehicle is improved. And damage caused by collision between the unmanned aerial vehicle and the carrier is avoided.

title: Control circuit, control system and terminal equipment
abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of remote control, and discloses a control circuit, a control system and terminal equipment, the control circuit comprises a single-chip microcomputer, at least one remote sensor, at least one keyboard key, a display screen and a central processor; the single chip microcomputer is connected with the remote sensor, the keyboard key and the central processing unit, the display screen is connected with the central processing unit, and the central processing unit is in wireless connection with flight equipment; the single-chip microcomputer is used for obtaining remote sensing data sent by the at least one remote sensor and key data sent by the at least one keyboard key, and sending the remote sensing data and the key data to the central processor. Therefore, the technical problem that the flight equipment cannot be normally controlled due to the fact that an externally connected data line is easily disconnected can be solved.
